svcsubsecinfo.para: Refer to Circuit Diagram Book CTS-5119S or CTS-5119TA in GROUP 08 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
The Speedo/Tach module performs electronic gauge circuit diagnostics(speedometer, tachometer, oil pressure, water temperature, fuel and voltmeter) and gauge sensor diagnostics.

The Speedo/Tach module does not checkthe standard 3-pin electrical gauges, circuits or senders. Section 6.0 contains step-by- step fault trees to troubleshoot the electronic gauges and the standard electrical gauges.

The Speedo/Tach module performs self-diagnostics at power up for the gauge circuits and sensors. The Speedo/Tach module uses gauge pointer movement and the alarm to communicate the faults to the driver or service technician. The alarm and pointer movements used to communicate conditions are:

item.para: At power up if all six gauge pointers make one full sweep, this indicates all circuits are working properly.
Speedometer and Tachometer pointer "less than full sweep" movements are used in the Gauge Circuit Diagnostics.
In Sensor Diagnostics, faults are noted by the individual gauges pointing to the six o'clock position (down). The alarm will also sound three long beeps.

step1.para: When the key is turned ON, the pointers will make one full sweep (through the entire range of each gauge, 0-3500 rpm & 0-85 mph) indicating that all of the electronic gauge circuits are working properly.

step2.para: If one or more of the gauge pointers goes to the 6 o'clock position and the alarm sounds three long beeps, go to SENSOR FAULT DIAGNOSTICS.
If one or more of the gauges does not go through the full range, but is not at a 6 o'clock position, go to GAUGE CIRCUIT TROUBLESHOOTING.

step1.para: If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 500 rpm while the speedo sweeps between 0 and 14 mph, replace the Speedo/Tach module.
If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 1000 rpm while the speedo sweeps between 0 and 25 mph, replace the Speedo/Tach module.

If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 1500 rpm while the speedo sweeps between 0 and 38 mph, this indicates the J1708 data link circuits may be defective. Go to SUSPECT DATA LINK CIRCUITS.

If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 2000 rpm while the speedo sweeps between 0 and 50 mph, the odometer drive circuit is bad. Replace the Speedo/Tach module.

If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps between 0 and 2500 rpm while the speedo sweeps between 0 and 65 mph, the odometer or the circuit is open or disconnected. Check connections. If connections are good, replace the Speedo/Tach module which contains the odometer.
